IRenderMaterial.h

This file defines the published interface for render materials.

Types
EShaderAccess

Indicates whether a material is used by a pixel or vertex shader or both

Header

Rendering/Caustic/IMaterialAttrib.h

IMaterialAttrib

Used for manipulating the materials assigned to a mesh.

Header

Rendering/Caustic/IMaterialAttrib.h

const char *pName
) = 0

Sets the name of the material (mostly used for debugging)

Parameters

const char*

name of material

GetName
virtual std::string GetName() = 0

Returns name of material

GetIsTransparent
virtual bool GetIsTransparent() = 0

Indicates whether material is considered transparent

Returns

Returns true if material is considered to be transparent. False otherwise.

SetIsTransparent
virtual void SetIsTransparent(
bool isTransparent
) = 0

Allows client to override whether material is considered transparent

Parameters
isTransparent
bool

override whether material is transparent

GetIsShadowReceiver
virtual bool GetIsShadowReceiver() = 0

Indicates whether the surface acts as a shadow receiver

SetIsShadowReceiver
virtual void SetIsShadowReceiver(
bool receivesShadow
) = 0

Allows client to set whether the surface is a shadow receiver

Parameters
receivesShadow
bool

If true material is acts as a shadow receiver. Otherwise, it doesn't

) = 0

Parameters

const wchar_t*

name of property (e.g. "DiffuseTexture")

pImage
IImage*

Image to use as texture

access
EShaderAccess

Indicates whether texture is accessible from pixel, vertex, or both shaders

SetTextureViaFilename
virtual void SetTextureViaFilename(
const wchar_t *pName,
std::wstring &filename,
EShaderAccess access
) = 0

Loads a texture from the spcified file and sets it to the specified property name

Parameters

const wchar_t*

name of property being assigned (e.g. "DiffuseTexture")

filename
std::wstring&

access

CreateStandardMaterial
CAUSTICAPI CRefObj<IMaterialAttrib> CreateStandardMaterialAttrib(
FRGBColor ambientColor,
FRGBColor diffuseColor,
FRGBColor specularColor,
float specularExp,
float alpha
)

Creates a standard material (as specified in the Phong lighting model)

Parameters

FRGBColor

ambient color

diffuseColor
FRGBColor

diffuse color

specularColor
FRGBColor

specular color

specularExp
float

value of exponent in specular

alpha
float

transparency value

Returns

Returns the new material object
